thread.title: Danka Kovinic advances in Tianjin to become first Montenegrin in a WTA final
thread.title_full: Danka Kovinic advances in Tianjin to become first Montenegrin in a WTA final

title: Danka Kovinic advances in Tianjin to become first Montenegrin in a WTA final
text:
Danka Kovinic advances in Tianjin to become first Montenegrin in a WTA final 17 Oct 2015 08:01:58 
Danka Kovinic will become the first Montenegrin to contest a WTA final on Sunday after setting up a showdown against Agnieszka Radwanska at the Tianjin Open. 
Kovinic saw off Serbian Bojana Jovanovski 6-4 6-7 (2/7) 6-2 in the first semi-final of the day. 
The 20-year-old was already the first Montenegrin player to reach a WTA quarter-final, something she had achieved six times, but her victory over Chinese wildcard Duan Ying-Ying here on Friday made her the first to reach a semi-final and she has now gone one better. 
If she is to crown that achievement by taking the title, she will need to overcome second seed Radwanska, who breezed past third seed Karolina Pliskova 6-3 6-1. 
Radwanska, the world number six, will be assured of a place at the WTA Finals if she can take the title. Related Sport News
